intro: Koeleria albovii var. buschiana, commonly known as the Busch's iceplant, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit and features small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and is adapted to cold, harsh environments. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in tundra and alpine habitats. Koeleria albovii var. buschiana is a member of the Poaceae family, which includes grasses.
